content.description: P1, 5.8+, climb up crimpers and small cracks to bolted anchor (anchor for P1 of Iron Heart). P2 5.9+, continue up about 5 feet to the right of the bolt line for Iron Heart to the anchors on oak tree ledge. With a 70M rote you can be lowered or descend with a single rap. With a 600M rope you will need to descend in 2 raps.
content.location: Starts about 8 feet to the right of Iron Heart. Shares same P1 and P2 anchors with Iron Heart

content.description: P1 is 5.8 and P2 is 5.10a. Can easily climbed as a single pitch. However, lowering from the top requires a 70M rope. If climbing with a 60M, belay your second from the top and descend the route in 2 raps.
content.protection: Bolts and small cams for protection. Both Anchors are bolted with hangers but no chains
content.location: Center of Sean's Wall. First bolt is 8 feet off the ground behind a tree.

content.description: This route is often climbed without gear which gives the first 30 feet an R/X rating on 5.5-6 climbing. The upper section is steeper and bolt protected up to the chain anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts and a .5, .75 and or #1 camalot to protect the lower section.
content.location: This is the route furthest to the right. Start from a clear gravel area near a piñon pine at the base.

content.description: P1, 5.3: Climb past a few bolts and place cams to reach a bolted anchor below  a large bolder 1/3 of the way up the wall. P2, 5.5 traverse right and climb up to oak tree ledge.  Can easily be climbed as a single pitch if you extend draws on your cam placements. Descend by rappelling from the anchors on Oaktree ledge. Can descend in a single rap with 70M rope, or two raps with 60M rope (use P1 anchor of Iron Heart for your second rap).
content.protection: Bolts and gear up to 3". Both anchors are bolted with hangers but no chains
content.location: Left third of Sean's wall. Two bolts lead up to a 2 bolt anchor at the base if a large bolder about 1/3 of the way up the wall

content.protection: Small cams. Bolted hangers at the top of route, no chains
content.location: Twin seams left of Iron Heart.

content.description: This wall is just to the right of The Co-op Area on the tall south facing wall. The climbs on the left are high quality easy slab climbing and the routes on the right are very good quality steep mixed climbing. It is difficult to set the upper routes up on TR and requires lots of scrambling both up and down to get to the chains. The routes on the lower level require very exposed traversing to get to the anchors. I suggest leading routes. This is a great place to bring a group of mixed abilities. A 60 meter rope is adequate but shorter ropes will not work.
